snippet: Mr. Borgnine, a rough-hewn actor who seemed destined for tough-guy characters, won an Oscar for embodying the gentlest of souls, a lonely Bronx butcher, in “Marty.”
abstract: Ernest Borgnine, rough-hewn actor who seemed destined for tough-guy roles but who won an Academy Award-winning for embodying the gentlest of souls, lonely Bronx butcher in 1955 film Marty, dies at age 95.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Borgnine, a rough-hewn actor who seemed destined for tough-guy characters, won an Oscar for embodying the gentlest of souls, a lonely Bronx butcher, in “Marty.”

headline.seo: Ernest Borgnine, Tough but Tender Actor, Is Dead at 95
headline.main: Ernest Borgnine, Oscar-Winning Actor, Dies at 95
headline.print_headline: Ernest Borgnine, Tough but Tender Actor, Dies at 95
